Articles.Content: so, i am completely new to modding. i know a little blender, and i am having problems getting started with actually making a mod. 1. i can't seem to find any tutorials that is new 2. the link for the unity asset, just sends me to the kerbal website and i can't seem to find anything in there about the link. so if anybody would take a little time to give me some directions or even links to tutorials, i would be happy ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) All help is appreciated. (sorry for bad grammar and english, not native. and i am also a bit new to the forum, so i am sorry if this is a stupid post.)
Did you look at the sticky in this subforum?
i have looked at some of the stickies and found some quite usefull, yet that 0.23 part tools download link still just sends me to the kerbal website.
I added a new link to the part tools in the sticky

> 
> i have looked at some of the stickies and found some quite usefull, yet that 0.23 part tools download link still just sends me to the kerbal website.

Ok but my dev sticky is huge. What do you mean you found it quite useful? All the info you need is there.

well, i haven't looked it all through yet, but what i am looking for i have not found yet. So i will proceed to look it all through. but an example is this [Part Modelling Guidelines](http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Part_Modelling_Guidelines) - Out of date / almost never updated. wich annoys me a bit, because i am looking on how to model and make my own parts for KSP. (sorry for bad grammar. just came home) 

- - - Updated - - -

thank you alot, new to forums, so didn't see there where several pages, thanks alot ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Ok but my dev sticky is huge. What do you mean you found it quite useful? All the info you need is there.

That might be a slight overestimation of the usefulness of any sticky. Even with tutorials you need a fair amount of trial and error to get things working, and sometimes you want things that are not done before.
